title: TikTok Sparks Inspiration—And Pressure—As Students Shop For School
description: TikTok shopping hauls can provide inspiration and pressure for young students heading back to school.

title: Is Pink Still a ‘Girl Color’? An Exploration
description: I don’t know how to feel about pink. The color has been inescapable of late, as Barbie branded shoes, clothes, rugs, and pool floats dominate my social media feeds. But the very meaning of pink seems to be changing. Barbie director Greta Gerwig has successfully wrapped a feminist message up in the traditionally girlie hue.…

title: Meta Takes Down ‘Largest Ever’ Chinese Influence Operation
description: New details on a vast effort that may be only the beginning of China's information-warfare ambitions

title: Biden Administration Proposes Rule That Would Require More Firearms Dealers to Run Background Checks
description: The proposal comes after a mandate from President Joe Biden to find ways to strengthen background checks.

title: A Government Shutdown This Fall Seems All But Certain
description: The debates in Washington about whether a shutdown is inevitable have been replaced with talk of when it will happen and how long it will last.

title: Scientists Have Identified the Lyme Disease Genes Responsible for Severe Symptoms
description: Researchers report the most comprehensive genetic analysis yet of the Lyme bacterium, Borrelia burgdorferi—setting up new test possibilities.

title: There’s Now an At-Home Menopause Test, But Does Anyone Need It?
description: The DIY kit can give women information about their menopause stage, but doctors aren't convinced it’s necessary.

title: How One Piece‘s Global Fanbase Led to a Netflix Live Action Series
description: The revered manga series 'One Piece' has been adapted into a live action Netflix series

title: Oprah Winfrey and Dwayne Johnson Launch Fund with $10 Million for Displaced Maui Residents
description: The People's Fund of Maui will give $1,200 a month to adults displaced because of the recent wildfires.

title: Venice Review: Michael Mann’s Ferrari Races Along With a Sleek Energy
description: Ferrari, from director Michael Mann and starring Adam Driver, made its premiere at the Venice Film Festival. Read TIME's review.

title: The Man Who Upended Thailand’s Politics
description: Pita Limjaroenrat galvanized voters but was blocked from taking power. What’s next for him—and the nation?

title: What to Make of VinFast’s Wild Week On Wall Street
description: EV-maker VinFast lost some $90 billion in market value since Aug. 28, but it still remains one of the world's most valuable car companies.

title: Trump Pleads Not Guilty in Georgia Election Subversion Case
description: He said he'll skip a scheduled arraignment hearing next week.

title: How the Blue Super Moon Looked Around the World
description: A blue supermoon occurs, on average, once every 20 years. On Aug. 30, skygazers took full advantage of it.

title: What Tolstoy Can Teach Us About Geopolitics
description: To understand what might happen next in this tumultuous world, one needs a literary imagination, writes Robert D. Kaplan

title: Tropical Storm Idalia Swoops Through Carolinas, Leaves a Trail of Destruction in Florida and Georgia
description: Rescue and repair efforts continued in Florida's remote Big Bend area where Idalia made landfall Wednesday.

title: The Danger of ‘Invisible’ Biolabs Across the U.S.
description: U.S. bio labs outside of federal government and academia, and not working with a short list of the worst pathogens, face little oversight.

title: The 8 Best Korean Dramas on Netflix Right Now
description: From "The Glory" to "Mr. Queen" and "Hometown Cha-cha-cha" to "SKY Castle," these are the best K-dramas to stream on Netflix.

title: Behavior Is a Miracle Drug for Our Health
description: It’s the only way to truly move the needle on chronic diseases, writes Arianna Huffington.

title: The Roots of Christian Nationalism Go Back Further Than You Think
description: "To fully understand the deep roots of today’s white Christian nationalism, we need to go back at least to 1493," writes Robert P. Jones.

title: U.S. and 18 Nations Participate in Military Drills in the Indo-Pacific Amid Rising China Concerns
description: Soldiers from the U.S. and six other nations began annual training on Indonesia’s main island of Java while 12 other nations sent observers to the exercises.

title: Dozens Dead, Toll Climbing in Johannesburg After Fire Burns Building Settled by Homeless
description: At least 58 people died when a fire ripped through a multi-story building that had been overtaken by homeless people, emergency services said Thursday.
